body.name: PERECT Sonic Electric Toothbrush for Adults, Rechargeable Sonic Electric Toothbrush with 6 Brush Heads, 1 Charge for 90 Days,IPX7 Waterproof 5 Modes 3 Intensities, Smart Timer, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 4 hrs 16 mins
features: 【Sonic Cleaning and Multiple Functions】: Enjoy exceptional cleaning and 10x more plaque removal than a manual toothbrush. This toothbrush is suitable for all kinds of teeth, including braces. It uses sonic technology to deep clean your teeth and gums, leaving your mouth fresh and healthy.

【3 Frequencies and 5 Modes】: Customize your brushing experience with 3 strength options (High, Medium, Low) and 5 modes (Gentle, Clean, White, Polishing, Novice). The toothbrush has a 3-second buffer time before starting, so you can easily adjust to the mode you want.

【5H Quick Charge for 90 Days Use】: Charge your toothbrush in just 5 hours using any USB port (charger not included) and enjoy up to 90 days of use (2 times per day). The toothbrush has a high-capacity battery and fast-charging technology for your convenience.

【6 Dupont Brush heads】: Get 6 Dupont brush heads with dust covers to protect them from pollution. Each brush head lasts for 3 months, as recommended by dentists, giving you a total of 18 months of use. The brush heads are designed to fit your teeth and gums perfectly.

【IPX7 Waterproof and Travel-Friendly】: Use your toothbrush in the bath or shower wit hout worrying about water damage. The toothbrush is also lightweight and portable, making it ideal for home use or travel. With its sleek design and long battery life, this toothbrush is the best choice for a deep and thorough clean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Works as described. Holds a good charge and cleans teeth well. Good variety of vibration modes for comfort. Has enough replacement brushes to last over a year. An excellent value.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Only one flaw
reviews.reviewText: Works well. Comes with many heads.One problem: the power button is smooth and flush. So I keep accidentally pressing it.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for travel
reviews.reviewText: We have these at home and wanted one for our travel bags. Worked well and happy I ordered them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars PERECT Electric Toothbrush: Perfectly Useless and a Waste of Money
reviews.reviewText: Well, where do I even start with this so-called "PERECT" electric toothbrush? Let's see, it comes with eight replacement heads but dies after just six months, so you won't even get to use all of them. But hey, at least you have eight useless heads to stare at while you mourn the loss of your electric toothbrush.And let's talk about those five useless modes, shall we? Because who doesn't love making brushing their teeth more complicated than it needs to be? I mean, who doesn't want to spend an extra five minutes trying to figure out which mode is the best one to use? Oh, and don't forget that one mode is enough, but let's just throw in a bunch of extra ones to confuse you anyway.And don't even get me started on the vibration. Apparently, this toothbrush is more of a vibrator than an actual toothbrush according to other comments. Fantastic. So not only did you waste $18 on a toothbrush that died after six months, but you also now have a heavy, useless, vibrating paperweight that does nothing but make your hand numb.I'm sure you're thrilled with your purchase and just can't wait to throw more money at this company for their amazing products. But if you're anything like me, you probably just want your money back and a real toothbrush that actually works. But hey, at least you got those eight replacement heads, right? Just in case you decide to buy another one of these toothbrushes that will inevitably die on you again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars battery no more holding the charge
reviews.reviewText: it was working fine but battery died after 8 months of use. still have some unused head replacement left!...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You NEED This
reviews.reviewText: Everyone, EVERYONE should have an electric toothbrush! It's BY FAR better for your teeth and gums just look for the one with soft bristles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great affordable electronic toothbrush with 8 replacement heads !
reviews.reviewText: I got this inexpensive electric toothbrush for my son who is starting to show much more interest in our Philips Sonicare toothbrushes. He used to be scared of the vibrations and I never pushed him but now he wants to use mine, so I decided it’s time to get him his own.Black is his favorite color so I figured this would be a good option.This toothbrush comes equipped with five cleaning modes that you can choose from and three levels of LOW, MEDIUM and HIGH intensity. My 5yo is only using LOW for now, the low noise is a plus because it keeps him from getting anxious. The modes are Gentle, Clean, White, Polishing, Novice. Each mode has a different pulsation/vibration pattern. My son is using Gentle mode at the lowest setting.The soft bristles are tough and flexible and have excellent elasticity. It includes eight replacement brush heads which can last us a long time!
